data.title: Career Listings
data.meta_description: The Digilogue explores the intersection of music, technology, and business, creating online and offline content for musicians, developers and digital creatives. #TheDigilogue
data.text:
Audio / Visual Sales & Integration Specialist

Systems Engineering Group (S.E.G.) a division of SKIPS MUSIC Inc. located in Sacramento California currently has an open position available for an Audio / Visual Sales and Integration Specialist.

The A/V Sales and Integration Specialist will execute business development and account management strategy, initiate contact with prospective customers, identify their needs, and sell appropriate systems to meet those needs. Once deals have been established, this role is responsible for guiding both the client and technical teams through installation and project completion. Â This individual will develop long-term strategic partnerships with customers to build re-occurring revenue streams.

Candidates considered for this role must have training and experience in the following areas:

Â· Â Â Conference and Meeting Room Systems

Â· Â Â Audio-Visual Control Systems

Â· Â Â Audio DSP Systems

Â· Â Â Video and Sound Engineering

Â· Â Â Digital Display Systems

Â· Â Â Experience with AV over IP Network Systems

Â· Â Â Demonstrated experience selling large complex AV systems into corporate enterprises and public institutions.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Â· Â Â Interact with prospective customers and establish buying cycles, customer needs, and create a positive and strong customer-vendor relationship.

Â· Â Â Perform needs analysis with customers to determine solutions that will meet their needs.

Â· Â Â Educate customers on current best practices and technology solutions that are appropriate for their environment and needs.

Â· Â Â Interpret consultant-designed RFPs, specs and drawings to develop equipment and labor estimates.

Â· Â Â Estimate and quote Audio-Visual systems including working with technical partners to develop thoughtfully designed systems proposals for customers that will successfully meet their requirements.

Â· Â Â Track active bidding opportunities (RFPs) and manage bidding response process.

Â· Â Â Sales forecasting and delivering on assigned quarterly and annual sales goals.

Â· Â Â Track, maintain, and regularly report a sales pipeline of viable sales opportunities.

Â· Â Â Prepare complete and detailed proposals and sales information presentations for customers.

Â· Â Â Prepare, update and modify project estimates and proposals throughout the purchasing cycle.

Â· Â Â Other Duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:

Â· Â Â 3+ Years of Sales and Account Management experience in the A-V system integration industry

Â· Â Â High School Diploma (or equivalent), College or specialty school a plus.

Â· Â Â Experience proposing and selling large-scale AV projects spanning wide areas for large enterprises and public institutions.

Â· Â Â Computer software skills required to effectively manage the selling and proposal process required including:

o Project Estimates in MS Excel

o Project Schedules in MS Project or other software

o Project Proposals, change orders and other correspondence.

o MS Office 365 applications

o Knowledge required to review, understand, and process construction documents, including:

Project specifications

Project Drawings

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Demonstrates effective negotiation and closing techniques

Strong cost analysis and project judgement skills

Works well in a team environment

Previous experience demonstrating sales skills and achieving/exceeding set sales goals and quotas.

Â· Â Â Must be responsible, self-motivated, self starter, personable and well-organized.

Â· Â Â Superior customer service skills with both internal and external customers.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Â· Â Â On-Site Desk and work space located within our facility.

Â· Â Â Regional travel to customer sites will be required.

Â· Â Â Some limited out of town travel may be required.

SALARY / COMP:

Â· Â Â Base Salary ($40,000 - $50,000) + Commission

We are seeking a dynamic self-starter who will pride themselves in representing our organization. Â Must have a can-do attitude and strong team spirit!

Visit our website at www.skipsmusic.com to learn more about us!

Employer requests a resume and current contact information be emailed to: hr@skipsmusic.com

Over the past decade, Mike & Mike's Guitar Bar has grown from a two-man dream in a garage to over 6000sq ft of showroom, media production and vintage instrument dedicated restoration space in the heart of Seattle's Fremont neighborhood. We're proud to be one of the world's leading used and vintage instrument retailers, and a Pacific Northwest destination for instrument repair.

We hire individuals who are passionate and engaged, with the goal of pushing the boundaries of what's expected of an instrument retailer. Curation is central to what we do, and we want to hire people that represent a diverse music landscape, sharing our deep appreciation for rare, vintage instruments and unique modern gear alike.

Mike & Mike's Guitar Bar is looking to hire an E-Commerce & Copywriting Coordinator who is proficient with e-commerce platforms and comfortable working to meet product listing quotas under deadlines. This role involves a significant amount of instrument-specific information, and while the ideal candidate may not know the ins-and-outs of every single piece of gear, it is important that they have strong baseline of knowledge with both electric and acoustic guitars. We value someone who has great autonomy but also can engage with ease with our various departments, and the ability to juggle multiple tasks is essential.

Applications from those who have been traditionally underrepresented in the music industry are strongly encouraged. We strive for our staff to be representative of a diverse and vibrant community that includes multiple identities, perspectives and influences.

Responsibilities

Generates and publishes template listings across e-commerce platforms

Meets daily quotas for product copy, effectively evaluates instruments both aesthetically and tonally

Regularly interfaces with our Photo and Service departments

Qualifications

Deep and specific gear knowledge

Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a strong attention to detail

Strong organizational and communication skills

Time management and detail orientation

Knowledge of photo editing software and product photography is a bonus

Hours

Our shop hours are Tuesday- Saturday, 10:30-6:30 and workdays and hours will be within the same period. This is a full-time position.

Benefits

We provide a competitive health plan option for our employees, paid time off, a retirement matching plan, employee discounts, and regular team events. If you want to work with a dynamic crew, please reach out today!

The ToniesÂ® Content Team is looking for a Senior Production Manager, Global Content to lead the development and execution of global content productions, including original IP development. The ideal candidate will be experienced in audio and music production, is a top-notch project manager, and is passionate about childrenâs content. They have an âearâ for what children of different age groups want to hear and know how to make it. This role works on content that is meant for global audiences, so multilingual candidates, with strong Spanish and French fluency, or experience with localization is a plus. This role requires a high level of organization, a rigorous attention to detail, and a truly collaborative approach.

Preferred working hours: 8-5 Eastern Time given that this role will have significant interaction with the German Central team so that crossover working hours are important to the ability of this new team member to work cooperatively with other key stakeholders. Percentage of travel required: flexible, probably at least 10%

The main responsibilities of this position:

Oversee ideation and conception of original global content, including stories and music.

Build the budget, timeline and identify the best-fitted production and creative set-up to bring a defined audio content vision to life.

Responsible for providing direction to partners at all stages of the creation process from scripting to audio recordings.

Develop and nurture good working relationships with production companies. Make sure the different creatives involved work well together and that the production is delivered on time and within budget.

Anticipate and find ways to solve creative and technical problems that occur.

Work closely with Project and Content Managers to ensure compliance with overall localization and global launch timeline.

Casting and directing voice talent as needed

Continual improvement of quality standards

Manage a direct report

Skills and Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years of audio, and/or content development experience in the childrenâs publishing, media, or toy space, ideally with multilingual projects needing strong Spanish and French fluency to execute

Proficiency in ProTools, Logic, and other audio production software

Strong project management skills, including the ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously, often 10+ at a time, prioritize effectively, and to meet deadlines with a sense of urgency

Experience with project management tools such as Asana and Jira

Basic knowledge and affinity for the field of childrenâs tv/podcast/audio

Basic understanding of early childhood and which content suits which age groups

Superior ability to manage short- and long-term projects simultaneously.

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to negotiate collaborative solutions

Ability to work well under pressure and problem-solve

Ability to work independently in a team setting

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Mindset

Importantly, this potential team member will have the mindset to:

Leave their thumbprint (an ownership mentality, not ego-driven, but results-driven)

Have hard conversations to keep projects on track

Provide positive, solution-oriented energy

Contribute everywhere, with a collaborative-spirit

Adapt to the tools and situations to find solutions

If this job is interesting to you, in addition to applying on this LinkedIn Job, please email usajobs@tonies.com with your resume and a short description on these two prompts:

Thinking about the attitudinal mindsets above, why are you the right person for a growth company like tonies right now? (250 words or fewer)

What is your favorite audio production for children that you contributed to and what were the key indicators that determined that success?"

Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Attention students passionate about music, TV, film, and pop culture, Consequence is seeking interns for fall of 2024.

Candidates for these remote work positions must be available 15-20 hours per week for an Eastern Time workday. Interns will be compensated with a stipend, and start and end dates are flexible based on school schedule.

Interns will participate in educational program specialized in Editorial or Social Media, with opportunities to hone their industry experience and knowledge both within and outside of the department for which they intern. Experience writing clean copy for a music or entertainment outlet is a plus.

Please include links to 2-3 writing samples/clips in your application.

Please submit your resume and cover letter to internship@consequence.net with the subject line âConsequence Internship â Fall 2024â as well as your internship field of choice.

Positions available include:

Editorial Intern

â Assist with writing news stories, premieres, and other articles

â Assist editorial staff with research, transcriptions, and building stories in the CMS

â Opportunity to pitch interviews/features to staff editors, undertaking assignments upon approval

â Opportunity to contribute to staff roundtables/lists

â Assist with administrative assignments

â Assist senior entertainment editor with research, transcriptions, and building stories in the CMS

â Opportunity to pitch interviews/features to staff editors, undertaking assignments upon approval

â Opportunity to contribute to staff roundtables/lists

â Assist with administrative assignments

Social Media Intern

â Assist in copywriting for posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok and more

â Assist in scheduling tweets and Facebook posts

â Assist in managing and develop strategies for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and more

â Research noteworthy historical moments, anniversaries, and birthdays

â Actively monitor social media for trending topics and content to share on our channels

â Engage with the Consequence audience

â Assist with analytics

We have a very exciting opportunity for a talented and ambitious Head of Operations to join the Brooklyn Storehouse team and play a pivotal role in the running of our music events. Reporting to the General Manager, you will have scope to manage all aspects of the music events series. You will be accountable for the successful delivery of the music shows at the venue.

To be successful, you will have excellent previous demonstrable experience in a similar role within the entertainment industry, with a good understanding of live and electronic music events. You will have a natural passion for customer service combined with strong operational acumen and excellent team leadership skills. You will be extremely organized, with a real ability to get things done, and a strong determination and understanding of how to drive the business forward. You will need to have excellent attention to detail, as we seek to continuously improve processes and innovate within the event spaces in which we operate.

We're looking for a strong communicator who is flexible in their working approach and is willing to get stuck in. The role will combine a mix of office and site-based working. During show days, this will be a very hands-on role, and you will be accountable for the build, break and overall delivery of show operations for each event.

Accountable and Responsible for:

Operations

Operational Planning & Delivery; leading with all aspects of operational planning, and leading the team to ensure the safe operational delivery and execution of all Brooklyn Storehouse music shows.

Managing operational planning, delivery, and coordination of all external suppliers, staff, artist brands, and promoters. Leading on pre-event and event-day briefings, ensuring all staff and suppliers have relevant information for a safe and successful event.

Ensuring any security, medical or safety incidents occurring on an event are managed and reported correctly, and any follow-up actions are recorded and actioned.

Ensuring the site is built well in advance of each event. Responsible for venue sign-off before doors open to the public.

Proposing new policies and procedures for Brooklyn Storehouse music shows.

Attending site visits as necessary with artists, promoters, and brands.

Educating your team in operations when required, ensuring they fully understand the expected standards and their role in delivering them.

Suppliers & Staffing

Managing all key suppliers from procurement to on-site delivery, including security, traffic management, medics, cleaners, bars, artist liaison, production, site crew, box office, coat check, and casual/freelance staff.

Ensuring effective negotiation, contracting, and management of suppliers.

Finance

Managing and reporting music event budget Profit & Loss, forecasting, and reconciliation.

Implementing commercial best practices to maximize yield and financial efficiencies.

Budgeting Management & Negotiation; assisting on the budget creation, ensuring supplier and staffing costs and quotes fall in line with the agreed budgets during the season and are efficiently managed, managing finance payment systems and working closely with the finance team to ensure accurate reporting.

Providing necessary reporting to the senior leadership team after each event.

Documentation

Managing and delivering detailed event documentation, including build and break schedules, event briefs, and end-of-night reports.

Working with the Broadwick Live/TCE team and key suppliers to develop a comprehensive suite of event documentation, including Event Operational Plan, Security Management Plan, Traffic Management Plan, Crowd Management Plan, and Event Risk Assessments.

External Stakeholder Management

Fostering a positive relationship with the Navy Yard management teams, local community, and other external stakeholders.

Ensuring agreed plans for ingress, egress, dispersal, noise management, and temporary infrastructure around the venue space and Zone X are implemented as per the plan.

Serving as the on-event day contact for liaison with external stakeholders.

Managing any complaints or concerns from external stakeholders professionally.

Team

Cultivating a work environment that reflects the company values and principles.

Overseeing the recruitment process for key internal positions.

Identify training needs and facilitate team development.

You'll need to have:

Minimum of 3 years of large-scale venue and event management experience, ideally in a music/entertainment events venue or portfolio.

Strong leadership and management skills; the ability to lead a team and make decisions whilst under pressure is key to this role.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Excellent radio etiquette.

Ability to keep calm, work under pressure and problem solve quickly.

Experience of producing, managing and delivering a venue budget, P+Ls and financial reports in conjunction with finance teams.

Exceptional organizational and planning skills.

Willingness to work on-site for long periods of time and flexibility with working hours.

Confidence in briefing contractors, staff and suppliers.

An excellent understanding of US compliance, legislation and codes of practice.

A good level of competency using Microsoft and Google Drive software, particularly Word, Outlook and Excel.

Self-motivation in addition to a positive and âcan-do' attitude in order to achieve tasks efficiently and to deadlines.

Great understanding and knowledge of the local event and venue industry.

Work Hours:

Minimum of 40 hours per week, must be available to work on weekends and holidays

At Brooklyn Storehouse, we are dedicated to cultivating a diverse and inclusive environment that empowers all individuals to reach their full potential. We strongly encourage applicants from all cultures and backgrounds to apply, as we believe in the strength of a diverse and vibrant team.

A little bit about our team:

You will be a part of the US Workplace Experience team, designed to imagine, create, and maintain innovative and safe workplaces to accommodate the needs of our dynamic business and global footprint.

Your role:

â You will support various department functions (Real Estate, Design/Build Projects, Hospitality, Facilities Operations, Lease Administration) with analysis, presentations, administration, and special projects for WMGâs domestic and international locations.

â Real Estate: Review/produce/analyze financial projections for real estate opportunities (lease transactions, acquisitions/dispositions, relocations, etc) in order to guide senior-management decision making. Research/apply industry standards/benchmarks.

â Design/Build Projects: Create support documentation such as schedules, budgets, overviews, and status updates for office/performance/studio design/build projects. Identify cost savings opportunities, review project documents, monitor and communicate with vendors, review and process invoices. Support ESG project initiatives.

â Hospitality: Build/maintain operational guides with location-specific content for WMG domestic/international properties. Communicate with internal property leads and external vendors to develop/manage database of functional contacts.

â Facilities Operations: Partner with Facilities/Finance to support initiatives including operating budgets, space programming, and regular reporting/audits.

â Lease Administration: Manage rent/operating payments and reconciliations. Work closely with external lease administration functions to develop data/reporting for management. Liaise with property management as needed.

Here youâll get to:

â Review/produce/analyze financial projections for real estate opportunities (lease transactions, acquisitions/dispositions, relocations, etc.) in order to guide senior management decision-making. Research industry standards/benchmarks.

â Work closely with WMGâs external lease administration function to manage rent-related payments, develop data/reporting management, liaise with property management as needed.

â Facilitate communication between WMG and external project vendors, providing updates to management.

â Provide financial analysis and updates from project approval through completion; manage and update all budgets; create capital request approval documentation and streamline approval process.

â Create support documentation for projects (design and build of office/performance/studio space) such as schedules, budgets, overviews, and status updates.

â Lead/manage select projects.

â Build/maintain operational guides with location-specific content for WMG domestic/international properties. Communicate with internal property leads and external vendors to develop/manage database of functional contacts.

â Support annual Facilities/Finance initiatives. Assist in development of building operating budgets, space allocations.

â Assist in support documentation and development for departmental initiatives - including RFQs / RFPs, Bid Leveling Sheets, Scope Documents, Business Cases, etc. These may include new platforms, applications, products, and partnerships that impact one or more of the Workplace Experience teams.

About you:

â 2+ yearsâ experience as analyst or equivalent

â Strong Power Point / presentation skills

â Strong Excel / analytic skills. Ability to manage large data sets and produce financial models.

â Capable of simultaneously handling multiple projects in varying workstreams

â Proactive, results-oriented, strong execution and follow-up skills

â Bachelorâs degree, preferably in business or related field

â Strong organizational, prioritization, and time-management skills

â Energized team player

â Organized / ability to plan and schedule meetings

Weâd love it if you also had:

â Experience in a Workplace Services-related field (Real Estate, Design/Build Projects, Hospitality, Facilities Operations, Lease Administration)

â Experience with music / the music industry

â Knowledge of ESG standards

â Experience with Tableau

Salary Range

$65,000 to $70,000 Annually

The Vendor Manager position is for a passionate customer and brand advocate within Amazon with proven analytical capabilities, project management skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize. This position supports our Vendor Manager team who are P&L owners and hands on operator with some of the world's greatest brands that have a direct selling relationship with Amazon. This VM must be an excellent communicator and excellent at prioritizing numerous tasks - this person will work cross-functionally every day with supply chain, finance, advertising, etc. to ensure that your businesses are positioned for growth an sustainable success. A great VM candidate is someone that has a "can do" attitude, is passionate about driving customer-centric outcomes, and has a track record of delivering business results. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a passion for retail and a high level of flexibility and commitment.

Key job responsibilities

A successful Vendor Manager will be able to:

- Act as the business owner for assigned categories, possessing a complete understanding of Amazon tools and resources in order to resolve defects in listings and create the best customer experience.

- Support the creation of promotions, monitor and analyze results, in order to achieve business objectives.

- Maximize Amazonâs selection opportunities by identifying gaps and working with vendors to resolve.

- Have a complete understanding of the customer needs, both existing and potential, and use that knowledge to advocate for and drive delivery of site features that provide Amazon customers with an unparalleled shopping experience

- Coordinate with cross-functional teams, and communicate with internal stakeholders, while meeting tight deadlines

- Conduct financial analysis of business opportunities to meet and exceed revenue and profitability targets

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

- 1+ years of account management, project or program management or buying experience

- Bachelor's degree

- Experience using Excel and other business analytic tools

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience with software and editing tools (including HTML, Excel and SQL)

- Experience in online retail

- Experience using analytical specific tools such as Google Analytics, SQL or HTML

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $48,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $103,400/year in our highest geographic market.

Our culture

If you want to work at a charity with people and music at its heart; that is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace full of inspiring colleagues who work tirelessly to put those we exist to serve front and centre of everything we do; if you want to work collaboratively with integrity and kindness and are willing to come with us on a journey as we work together and collectively come to work with strong backs, soft fronts and wild hearts, we could be your next team.

Could this be the place for you?

If you are values driven, courageous, curious, agile, flexible, enthusiastic and future focused (without losing sight of the here and now), if you can bring positivity and accountability to your work, if you strive for brilliance, challenges excite you and if you would speak with passion and dedication about our cause we want to hear from you!

What we need

About the role

The Music Industry Lead is key to amplifying the work of Nordoff and Robbins through delivering a successful artist/celebrity ambassador program. This role will support the growth of our audiences by aligning high-profile voices with our events portfolio, marketing campaigns, and press opportunities, consistently increasing the reach of the charity. It also supports the understanding of our work by identifying media opportunities to tell our stories in collaboration with the engagement and communications team.

Strong interpersonal skills are essential to keep our ambassadors informed and engaged in our work as well as identifying and onboarding new voices who can champion our cause and grow our audience

The Music Industry Lead is part of the Music Industry team reporting into the Head of Music Industry. The post holder will be responsible for maintaining music industry relationships, identifying, recruiting and stewarding all artists, VIPs and celebrities to support the work of Nordoff and Robbins through an all year-round ambassador engagement programme that also generates income from artist led activities.

You will be an ambassador for N&R in all your interactions

You will create healthy working relationships across external networks important to N&Râs ambitions

You will attend and support our fundraising events in your capacity as Music Industry Lead at N&R â This will include some evening and weekend work at times.

What we offer

The three best things about the job (in our humble opinion)

You will be joining an award-winning events team, with sector leading music awards show and many other industry events.

You will be fully supported as you learn and develop in the role and able to learn from very experienced colleagues.

You will be working on a broad spectrum of diverse and growing range of fundraising events in the sector.

A salary of Â£37,789 plus Â£1,500 London Weighting (where applicable) total Â£39,289

Pension scheme

31 days annual leave plus bank holidays

Salary sacrifice benefits including cycle to work

Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)

A true People First charity with training and career development as part of our core

An inclusive culture â and lots of music!

London/Hybrid working (mix of office and home â minimum 2 days per week in London office NW5 1PQ) This is a full time position and may include some evenings and weekends as required.

â

I want to apply. What next?

Please apply with a CV and cover letter detailing your interest in the role and how your skills and experience match our requirements.

Email us at recruitment@nordoff-robbins.org.uk

Please note applications without a covering letter will not be considered. Why? We want to hear about you as a person not just a list of your work accomplishments.

Closing date: Monday 2nd September 2024 at 11:59pm

Interviews: Week beginning 9th September 2024, online interview via zoom.

This role is subject to a Basic DBS check. We are a Disability Confident Employer.

BMGâs Royalty & Client Services team serves as a crucial touch point for all internal and external inquiries. We provide first class service & support to our writers, artists, and our colleagues in other departments. We focus on accurate and timely responses with attention to detail and empathy, striving to create and maintain trust for our clients and working partners by efficiently reviewing and resolving their concerns in a timely manner. Our department works alongside all other BMG teams, including but not limited to: Copyright, Synch Licensing, Royalty Processing, Legal & Business Affairs, and Finance, which provides exposure to various parts of the industry. As a team member you will bring a desire to help others, an eagerness to learn and an overall positive attitude. In this role, you will be a core member of the team, requiring attention to detail, patience, and time management. Your responsibilities will include handling client account updates to aid in facilitating accurate payments to our clients, assisting department management with outreach projects related to our VIP partner deals, and handling key tasks associated with royalty distribution preparation.

Join us in delivering exceptional service and support, and play a pivotal role in maintaining the trust and satisfaction of our clients and working partners!

What Youâll Be Doing.

Complete reoccurring tasks related to Royalty distribution preparation.

Assist Royalty Manager with large-scale client outreach projects for VIP partner clients.

Independently resolve basic to intermediate client inquires, including: address changes, bank account updates, tax updates, myBMG account creations, statement and payment questions, income tracking, and synch.

Coordinate with Finance and Bertelsmann Accounting Services (BeAs) alongside Royalty Manager to ensure that we stay current with open items before releasing payments.

Field client phone calls received by BMG front desk and those forwarded by departmental management. Log issues reported in JIRA, distinguishing between issues that can be resolved and those that must be assigned to other Royalty Services staff.

Serve as the primary point for Production Music client set-up and assist the Production Music team with client paperwork.

Investigate, review, and resolve inquiries internally and externally by way of research, problem solving, and collaboration with other departments.

Perform ad hoc tasks as needed to support the department and BMG clients.

Must Haves.

Proven ability to multitask, manage time efficiently, and prioritize tasks effectively.

Exceptional attention to detail and strong organizational skills.

Intermediate skills with MS Excel, including: VLOOKUP, pivot tables, cleaning data, conditional formatting, etc.

Demonstrated experience in music or a related industry working with publishing royalties, financial accounting, Â and/or large data clean-up projects.

Excellent interpersonal skills with the capability to tailor communication styles for various internal and external interactions, approach clients with patience and empathy, and build strong relationships with clients and colleagues.

Ability to seamlessly transition between analytical & service-oriented trains of thought.

Itâs also a plus (not a must) if you have experience with iMaestro, SAP, JIRA Service Desk, and Google OneDrive.

Whatâs In It For You?

Enjoy flexibility with our hybrid setup: 3 days in office, 2 days remote.

Experience peace of mind knowing that our comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage has got you covered.

Maximize your savings with our dollar-for-dollar 401(k) match of up to 6% after your first year.

Take time off to recharge with 19 days of vacation per year.

Save money and time with our commuter benefits program.

Stay healthy and earn financial rewards with our fitness reimbursement program and wellness incentives.

Access well-being support 24/7 through our Employee Assistance Program.

Kick off your weekends early with Summer Fridays.

Unlock your potential with development opportunities, including mentorship programs, LinkedIn Learning and educational reimbursements.

Be inspired by our talented artists at our showcases and playbacks.

Pay Range

$50,000 - $54,000 per annum

The pay range listed above is dependent upon factors such as work experience, qualifications and business needs. In addition to the range above, this role is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus and applicable benefits.

We are seeking a Manager, Distribution Operations to join the Revenue Operations

team. Who are working to take Vevoâs business to the next level. This position will

report directly to the Director of Distribution Operations, and will be a member of the

broader Sales and Distribution team.

The Distribution Operations team plays a key role in the companyâs evolving strategy,

ensuring that Vevo drives revenue across our platforms. As Manager, Distribution

Operations, you will help drive operational expansions and enhancements across our

ever growing distribution landscape. You will ensure that internal and external teams

are meeting deadlines and driving to the same priorities set by the leadership team.

You will work cross-functionally in partnership with Vevoâs Product & Engineering,

Revenue Operations, Distribution Partnerships, Content & Programming, Business

Development, Finance, and Data Operations teams. The ideal candidate has

experience in the world of AVOD and Fast Channel platforms with a focus on driving

platform launches and product enhancements. This candidate has working knowledge

of the Ad Tech, Product & Engineering, and Data space as it relates to AVOD and

FAST Channel platforms. This candidate is also an effective communicator and leader

of people.

This is a full-time, hybrid position based in our New York City office.

As a member of our team, you will:

Assist the Director of Distribution Ops in driving distributionâs operational strategy on a day-to-day basis ensuring execution across all partners.

Project manage Vevoâs new partner distribution launches, delivering all required collateral (URLs for testing, logos, channel artwork etc).

Manage tracking and dissemination of information regarding all cross departmental projects related to distribution and ensure all stakeholders are aware of project timelines and updates.

Work hand in hand with the Distribution Partnerships team and support all ongoing operational needs of Vevoâs CTV distribution partners.

Work with Gracenote and distribution partners to ensure Vevo FAST channel EPGs are updated and accurate.

Identify and improve process inefficiencies within the distribution ecosystem.

This describes you:

You share our passion for music and digital media; have a genuine curiosity for emerging digital media and advertising technology.

You enjoy both collaborative and self-directed projects and can work effectively in each.

You draft and communicate articulately to actively solve problems and provide a unique perspective.

You have a track record of questioning the status quo to achieve positive results.

You are comfortable with ambiguity and an ever-changing landscape.

You thrive in high pressure situations.

You have experience taking fun seriously and cheering up your teammates when they need some positive encouragement; you naturally understand that work isnât work when you love what you do.

You can see the âbig pictureâ and translate high-level strategy to day-to-day implementation.

You successfully navigate complex problems by crafting unconventional solutions.

Requirements:

You have ideally 2+ yearsâ experience in media, advertising and/or technology company, with a focus on distribution, connected television media, advertising technology, and/or product.

Proactive and detail-oriented thinker with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

Exceptional leadership and relationship management skills.

Experience leading and managing people.

Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities under time constraints.

Highly proficient in Microsoft Office

Interested? Great! You might like to know:

We're a fun, energetic, and tight knit team

We really enjoy music and technology

We have excellent compensation and benefits packages

We have premier access to music content and new releases of original media content - not to mention live Vevo-produced musical performances

We offer a very competitive Benefits package

Inside Sales Representatives speak with hundreds of businesses a week (by phone) selling music licenses. Responsibilities include the discovery and development of songwriters and music publishers, forming and maintaining relationships within all aspects of the music industry. In this role, you will be responsible for the discovery and development of up-and-coming, as well as established, songwriters and music publishers. This role will require strong interpersonal skills and strategic mindset to drive ASCAPâs goals and initiatives. Key functions also include attending evening events such as mixers and song camps, and attending industry events, market research, and occasional public speaking. The person in this role must stay informed about the music industry at large.

Job Description

TuneCore is looking for an Artist Success Manager - Hip Hop to join our team by supporting the companyâs high value client experience strategy with creativity and innovation at the forefront of the role.

TuneCoreâs Artist Success team works with our strategic high value US artist and B2B label accounts, DSP partners and internal teams to provide a best-in-class digital distribution experience.

As an Artist Success Manager - Hip Hop, youâll provide highly personalized, white-glove, omnichannel support to TuneCoreâs strategic accounts. Youâll also work cross-functionally with several teams throughout the business to ensure TuneCore delivers the best product experience on the market by advocating for the needs of these accounts both during product development and through regular feedback sessions throughout the year.

Youâll have the opportunity to guide high-value clients through their entire release lifecycle, from catalog upload and release day, to sales reporting and performance. In addition to ensuring their successful releases, it will be up to you to ensure that TuneCoreâs most important clients have access to industry news, best practices, upcoming product launches, cross-promotion, monetization optimization through TuneCoreâs Accelerator program, early access opportunities, and beyond.

To be successful in this role, youâll need to be a seasoned music industry professional with demonstrated client success experience, and a deep knowledge of operational best practices. Youâre a strategic thinker who can solve both the immediate problem in front of you as well as the overarching issue at hand. Youâll be expected to have availability outside of regular business hours in order to enable your accounts to plan and execute their unique release strategies. Finally, youâre someone who knows when to simply roll up your sleeves, dig in, and get the job done.

âSalary: $83,400-$100,100

Role Duties

You will be in a client-facing role that encompasses the following responsibilities:

Own and manage a cohort of strategic TuneCore accounts - with a strong focus on Hip Hop and R&B clients - to ensure seamless distribution experiences from start to finish.

Partner with the Artist & Partner Relations team to identify growth opportunities for high value accounts as well as retention opportunities for at risk accounts.

Partner with Artist Support & Operations teams to optimize processes and resolve high profile client issues quickly and efficiently.

Participate in client retention and brand building activities in the music community alongside other members of the TuneCore team.

Build strong brand loyalty through relationship building, release management, and opportunity sharing.

Manage education programs that help artists to accelerate their career growth.

Assist in catalog transfers and cross sell opportunities with TuneCoreâs parent company, Believe.

Identify, alongside Believe, cross-stream opportunities for new and existing clients.

Represent TuneCore and immerse yourself further into the Hip Hop / R&B music community by attending conferences, events, and showcases, partnering with the Marketing teams to maximize reach and engagement.

Engage with music communities both on and off-line extolling the benefits of TuneCore.

Curate and manage a suite of data, key metrics and analytics, reviewed regularly, to establish a formula for account health and churn risk.

Additional special projects as needed.

Qualifications

5+ years experience working in the music industry preferably in distribution, artist management, or independent labels.

Strong knowledge and familiarity with Hip Hop / R&B music, artists, style, culture.

Excellent communications skills: written, verbal and interpersonal.

Must be an enthusiastic self starter with a proven track record of executing client retention programs and artist growth opportunities.

Extremely technologically savvy with both known platforms and tools, as well as picking up proprietary tech quickly.

Be highly motivated with the ability to solve problems creatively and quickly.

Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize, multi-task and work under shifting deadlines.

Must be collaboration minded and comfortable working cross-functionally across varying organizational levels.

You should be able to demonstrate thoroughness, follow-up/follow-through, and attention to detail.

BA/BS Degree

Expert in digital distribution and the digital music space, and common issues facing music professionals.

Knowledge and experience in social media.

Demonstrated leadership ability and a track record of successful planning and execution.

Proactive, energetic attitude with a desire to work in a results-oriented environment.

Knowledge of music metadata preferred.

Additional Information

Equipment Operations:

Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, Slack

Experience with Jira, Asana, customer relationship manager platforms (Zendesk, Salesforce, etc.)

Experience with digital content management systems (iTunes Connect, Music Providers, etc.), data platforms (Chartmetrics, Tableau), and streaming platform artist portals, preferred

Who We Are

We Are Social is a global socially-led creative agency with unrivalled social media expertise. With 1,300 people in 19 offices spanning four continents, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture.

We're proud to be a multi award-winning agency, with Cannes Lions, One Show, Webby and Shorty Awards, to name but a few. Our most recent work has seen us help Pepsi, Meta and Adidas deliver some of their biggest and most innovative campaigns to date, from breaking into the metaverse to smashing records on TikTok.

As well as creating for clients, we help educate the wider industry. Our Instagram publication The Feed tracks culture at the speed of social. 6,500 people registered or tuned into our events last year, and our reports garnered more than 20 million views.â

The Opportunity

Are you a natural communicator, friendly and approachable with good attention to detail and accuracy in all communication?

Want to create award-winning work for some of the most iconic global brands?

Do you have experience in being part of a team delivering multi-million Â£ campaigns, working as part of a cross-agency team?

We Are looking for a Project Manager to join an established team here in London who are pushing the boundaries of social media for a world-class music brand. The client is at the cutting edge of Black music culture, so we need a Project Manager who is on the pulse of what matters to this audience - UK R&B, Afro, Rap and Caribbean music. You will have proven experience in managing content production, as a large amount of the social content we produce is video content. We have an in-house Production department who take care of the big shoots for us, but smaller content pieces, e.g. TikTok assets are being produced by our creative departments, and we need our PMs to help plan the work, manage budgets, and ensure we deliver great quality work, whilst meeting deadlines.

âRequirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere?

Responsible for timing plans and budgets, ensuring that you have delivered within the set time and agreed budgets

Created and executed SoWs/delivery plans ensuring 100% clarity and understanding among stakeholders

Responsible for projects from a delivery perspective, from client brief to completion with minimal to no errors or delays

Experience with creative production for social media campaigns, including how the social assets are produced and how to help the creative teams do this efficiently and deliver the work 'right the first time'

Established client relationships, and used to being the main contact for the client on live projects, managing expectations and communications

Confident managing a variety of workstreams intended for social platforms, incl. TikTok content, Insta/X/Snap work and campaign work. Solid understanding of what paid vs organic means from a production perspective, and what constitutes clever innovation work in asocial space. Finally, experience of scoping, planning and executing influencer projects is key for this role

What Else Are We Looking For?

Strong financial focus with an understanding of ensuring we are delivering within budget and not over-delivering in comparison to the agreed scope of work. This includes weekly reconciliations and financial reporting to the Project Director

Video production experience, for small to medium-sized shoots, including pre-production, production and relevant documentation

Proactive and good at foreseeing problems, and can articulate these to the relevant people when required

Good with systems and resource booking/finance tools - our agency uses a selection of tools and as part of the PM team, you will be expected to learn how to use them well and stay on top of comms, bookings and planning via such tools daily.

Benefits

Our Culture and the Nice Stuff

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion runs in the water here at We Are Social. We are transparent about the changes that are needed, we are focused on making real strides, both internally and within the industry and we strive to truly be a workplace that represents, supports and advocates for ALL. Our Charter for Change in the UK can be found here which details our focus areas across People, Work and Culture in 2023.If you require any support, adjustments or accommodations for any reason whatsoever during the recruitment process, please let us know via recuitment@wearesocial.netSo let's get to the good stuff, we offer all those things you would naturally expect; 25 days holiday, pension scheme & life assurance. But what we love most is connection, so we have our WAS Passport and Work From Anywhere schemes which allow you to truly connect to colleagues all over the world!But what's life around here really like day-to-day? Well, we ask our people regularly what they think about us/their role and here are some of the most common things they say:

I value my manager we have a good relationship

We love to âget social' with the people I work with

Trusted to get on with the job, without âmicro-management'!

If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?

About The Kennedy Center

âI am certain that after the dust of centuries has passed over our cities, we, too, will be remembered not for victories or defeats in battle or in politics, but for our contribution to the human spirit.â â President John F. Kennedy

The Kennedy Center is the nationâs cultural center and living memorial to President John F. Kennedy. Located on the banks of the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., the Center presents performances across all genres, and is also home to artistic affiliates Washington National Opera and National Symphony Orchestra.

At the Kennedy Center, we strive to foster belonging and empowerment at work. We are able to advance our mission because of our committed and passionate employees. We are fortunate to be able to leverage their diverse perspectives, life experiences and skills to inform how our workplace can be a safe, transparent, and replenishing community. The Kennedy Center is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition, or any other basis protected by law.

Mission Statement: As the nation's performing arts center, and a living memorial to President John F. Kennedy, we are a leader for the arts across America and around the world, reaching and connecting with artists, inspiring and educating communities. We welcome all to create, experience, learn about, and engage with the arts.

Why Join Us

Staff offers for discount tickets

Retirement plan with organization matching (after 1 year of employment)

Qualifying employer for the Public Student Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF)

Commuter programs including pre-tax options for discounted parking and SmartBenefits (WMATA)

Annual Leave, Sick Leave, and Personal Days available immediately upon hire

11 paid holidays per year

Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits with FSA and HSA options, and paid FMLA

Flexible work arrangements

Job Description

The Marketing Manager for Jazz, Hip Hop, and Contemporary Music at the Kennedy Center is responsible for leading the development and execution of marketing strategies for these key programs. Reporting to the Vice President of Marketing, the Marketing Manager plays a pivotal role in crafting marketing strategies tailored to Jazz, Hip Hop, and Contemporary Music, aimed at maximizing audience engagement and revenue generation opportunities.

Under the guidance of the Vice President of Marketing, the Marketing Manager oversees all aspects of marketing strategy for the Kennedy Center's Jazz, Hip Hop, and Contemporary Music programs. This includes affinity relationship marketing activities, planning, data analysis, and reporting. The manager is responsible for determining and developing the value proposition for these genres, ensuring that the unique benefits and appeal of each program are clearly communicated to target audiences. Additionally, the manager implements dynamic pricing strategies to maximize revenue, adjusting ticket prices based on demand and other factors to optimize sales and attendance. The manager also serves as a liaison between internal staff and external representatives to ensure seamless coordination and alignment of marketing efforts.

Additionally, the Marketing Manager supervises the Assistant Marketing Manager, Comedy & Special Programming, helping develop and optimize campaigns for revenue generation. This role also provides mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities to foster their growth and success.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the development and execution of marketing strategies for Jazz, Hip Hop, and Contemporary Music, including planning, dynamic pricing, data analysis, and reporting.

Create season planning documents, detailed revenue projections, and strategic marketing plans.

Supervise and support Assistant Marketing Manager, Comedy & Special Programming, ensuring effective campaign development and execution while fostering professional growth and optimizing strategies for increased revenue generation

Serve as a liaison between internal staff and external representatives, ensuring seamless coordination of marketing efforts

Build and maintain various CRM lists in Tessitura

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to coordinate marketing initiatives and maximize audience engagement.

Other duties as assigned.

Key Qualifications

Bachelors degree preferred; must have at least 4-6 years professional experience in sales, marketing or performing arts management. Theater marketing experience preferred.

Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced team environment. In addition, the candidate must possess strong analytical skills and have the ability to produce effective oral and written communications. The person must maintain a high level of productivity and have increased attention to detail. He/she/they must also possess advance capabilities with standard personal computing programs. A working knowledge of CRM systemsâ¦Tessitura preferred.

Candidate must be local or willing to relocate to the DMV area.
